physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient was alert, normal mental status, neck was not tender, full range of motion, cranial nerves II through XII were normal, no nystagmus, photophobia present, pain with upward gaze, near point of convergence was 15 cm, mild sway on Romberg test, mild difficulties with double-leg, single-leg, and tandem stance.
Dried blood in right nostril, otherwise unchanged physical examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient reported nosebleeds lasting approximately 15 minutes every morning since the accident.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Limited ocular function, impaired smooth pursuit movements, saccades, convergence, and accommodation; impaired vestibular function; increased symptoms at heart rate >125 bpm.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By the patientâ€™s second appointment, the BPPV had resolved and vestibular and ocular function had returned to normal.
